data.title: Jenny McCarthy-Jim Carrey feud now includes her son: Favorite people
data.meta_description: The former Playmate says her ex-partner never tries to see her son, while the actor says he loves him "very much."
data.text:
Jenny McCarthy-Jim Carrey

not getting along 2 years later

It's been two years since

Jenny McCarthy

and

Jim Carrey

split up, ending a five-year relationship, but that doesn't mean they aren't still fighting.

And in the middle is McCarthy's autistic son,

Evan

.

, while also admitting she hasn't actually tried talking to Carrey herself.

"I think that sometimes people need to take a real break from each other," she said.

Carrey, while not disputing that he has not seen Evan, 10, took issue with how McCarthy handled things.

. "It's unfortunate that Evan's privacy is not being considered. I love Evan very much and will miss him always."

And while McCarthy says Evan is in therapy to deal with Carrey's absence, she's found a different way to cope, dating Chicago Bears linebacker

Brian Urlacher

.

Jon Hamm recalls being

told he'd never be a TV star

Jon Hamm

was told by the head of a network, who we're guessing would rather not have his/her name made known, that he would never make it in Hollywood.

r.

And that wasn't his only setback.

"(I lived in) L.A. for 10 years, not working, having no money and no prospects. The days were kind of great; it was the long nights staring at the ceiling waiting for the phone to ring," he remembered. "The uncertainty is always the difficult part, at least it has been for me."

Not that the "Mad Men" star, who is seemingly everywhere nowadays, has that to cope with anymore.

Khloe Kardashian starts

fertility treatment process

Khloe Kardashian

is undergoing fertility treatment to have a baby.

, so she visited a reproductive center in Beverly Hills, Calif., to get the process started.

So far, that consists of giving blood – with her sister Kim by her side – so her hormone levels can be evaluated.

Robin Roberts diagnosed

with bone marrow disease

e, a disease of the blood and bone marrow.

Roberts will need a bone marrow transplant later this year – her sister will be the donor.

"My doctors tell me I'm going to beat this – and I know it's true," Roberts wrote on the GMA website.

"If you Google MDS, you may find some scary stuff, including statistics that my doctors insist don't apply to me. They say I'm younger (she's 51) and fitter than most people who confront this disease and will be cured."

Portia de Rossi joins cast

for remake of 'The Munsters'

Portia de Rossi

NBC's "Munsters" reboot.

EW reports that DeRossi joins

Jerry O'Connell

(Herman),

Eddie Izzard

as Grandpa,

Mason Cook

as Eddie and

Charity Wakefield

as Marilyn.

"Mockingbird Lane" is being developed by "Pushing Daisies" creator

Bryan Fuller

and directed by "X-Men's"

Bryan Singer

.
